intro: Digitaria uniflora, commonly known as slender fingergrass, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as fields and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green color. Digitaria uniflora is often found in temperate and subtropical regions and is adapted to a variety of soil types.
